meanings.definition: To commit to memory; learn by heart.
meanings.sent1: She memorised the poem for the recital.
meanings.sent2: He memorised his lines for the school play.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel memorised the best spots to find nuts in the park.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song was so beautiful that it was easily memorised by everyone.
meanings.sent5: The safety instructions should be memorised in case of an emergency.

meanings.sent1: The image of the sunset was memorised in her mind.
meanings.sent2: The historical event was memorised by the students after the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat memorised the exact location of its favorite toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies in the kitchen was a memory that she memorised fondly.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of accomplishment after finishing the race was something he wanted to memorise forever.

meanings.sent1: The song lyrics were easily memorised by the audience.
meanings.sent2: The important dates in history were memorised by the students.
meanings.sent3: The dog memorised the route to the park for their daily walks.
meanings.sent4: The taste of the homemade pie was something she memorised for future baking.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers in the garden was a memory she wanted to memorise forever.
